intro: Choriophyllum, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its striking, translucent, and often colorful bracts that resemble petals, though they are not true flowers. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is known for its unusual appearance and limited distribution. Choriophyllum typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its specialized morphology. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
